Underwear.js

Showing your underscore in public can be embarrassing.

Underwear translates all the Underscore methods to the native JavaScript prototypes. For those of us who prefer this:

{% highlight js linenos %} [1, 2, 3].each(function(n) { alert(n); }); {% endhighlight %}

Those of us who don't mind extending the native prototypes prefer this to the somewhat clunky Underscore methods.

{% highlight js %} _([1, 2, 3]).each(function(n) { console.log(n); }); _.each([1, 2, 3], function() { console.log(n); }); {% endhighlight %}

Put on some underwear

Underwear.min.js (production 30k) Underwear.js (development 39k) View on GitHub

Underwear.js.

Underscore.js is a great library, but some prefer to extend the native prototypes with these types of methods. With Underwear.js, you can use the awesomeness of underscore from the comfort of your own objects.

Underwear translates all the underscore methods to native prototype extensions for those who prefer not to see skid marks in their code ;)

Source Documentation

Underwear is maintained by daytonn
